0.context: Mehrangarh Fort Amongst the best Jodhpur tourist places to visit it was built around 1460 A D by Rao Jodha Mehrangarh Fort is listed among the most magnificent hill forts of Rajasthan No wonder it is one of the best places to visit in Jodhpur Rajasthan Standing almost 100 feet above the city skyline the fort is built so flawlessly that you won t be able to make out where the hill ends and the walls begin making it one of the best places to see in Jodhpur Unbeatable and impressive this grandeur in red sandstone is wrapped in an eccentric beauty Needless to say when travellers look forward to the most remarkable tourist attractions in Jodhpur this fort is the foremost choice Its huge thick walls surprise you with grand palaces inside that are ornamented with intricate carvings The colossal structure also boasts of a museum that displays fascinating and precious artworks of great historical value One of the most beautiful things to see in Jodhpur Mehrangarh Fort invites you to an experience of a lifetime with its several cultural festivals such as the annual Rajasthan International Folk Festival in October and the World Sufi Spirit Festival in February So while making your list of Jodhpur tourist attractions missing out on this splendour in stone is a Entry fee International Tourists Includes the Audio INR 600 per person Domestic Tourists INR 70 per person Opening hours am to pmFast fact Mehrangarh Fort in Jodhpur is a popular site for movies sets It was one of the locations to shoot the movie The Dark Knight Rises released in June 2012 Built in 1459 Built by 1.context: Jaswant Thada Your Mehrangarh visit is coupled with a trip to Jaswant Thada that is certainly amongst the best Jodhpur tourist places to visit Standing adjacent to Mehrangarh Fort this is a cluster of majestic cenotaphs in white marble Built in 1899 A D in memory of Maharaja Jaswant Singh II the main cenotaph of these holds portraits of various Rathore rulers While visiting places in Jodhpur at this place you will feel tranquillity all around Also you will realize that it is more of a temple where deceased rulers are worshipped Also known as the Taj Mahal of Marwar the carvings of this monument are beautifully intricate A spectacular garden a pond and exquisitely carved gazebos manifold its charm Visit it on a sunny day to behold its beauty in full bloom When it is kissed by sun rays the extremely thin marble sheets of which it is made up glow golden Make a wish here Locals believe that the monument grants your wishes Entry fee International Tourists Includes the audio INR 30 per person Domestic Tourists INR 15 per person Opening hours am to pmFast fact The Pond of the Gods at Jaswant Thada is known to be the traditional cremation ground for the Jodhpur royals Built in 1899 Built by Maharaja Sardar Singh

2.context: Umaid Bhavan Palace Umaid Bhavan Palace is one of the visited places in Jodhpur when it comes to witnessing the luxurious side of the city Step into scrumptious luxury at Umaid Bhavan Palace Jodhpur a celebrated destination when it comes to famous places in Jodhpur Among the largest private residences on the globe this palace is named after Maharaja Umaid Singh grandfather of the current owner Gaj Singh Crowned with several features that make it an exquisite structure the palace has 347 rooms and a part of it is operated by the Taj Group of Hotels One of the best places to see in Jodhpur this palace holds a prominent position among places to see in Jodhpur A museum is also housed in a part of this magnificent structure Don t miss to see its galleries housing various regal items one gallery dedicated to displaying a variety of an item For instance a gallery showcases a host of royal clocks and one of those displays royal vintage cars Make sure you visit the grandeur spread in every nook and corner of this palace So if you wish to see the best tourist attractions of Rajasthan make sure to plan a vacay to Jodhpur and explore this magnificent spot Entry fee Umaid Bhawan Palace International Tourists INR 50 per person Domestic Tourists INR 25 Umaid Bhawan Palace Museum International Tourists INR 100 Domestic INR 30 per adult INR 10 per child Opening hours Umaid Bhawan Palace am to pm Sunday to Saturday Umaid Bhawan Palace Museum am to pm Monday to Saturday Fast fact Once upon a time Jodhpur erstwhile Marwar was hit by famine in the 1920s People approached Maharaja Umaid Singh for help To provide employment to people he generously commissioned a new palace The venture resulted in helping people survive the tough time and emerged as a symbol of hope in times of trouble Thus the palace was built for a noble cause Built in 1943 Built by Umaid Singh 20 Things To Do In Rajasthan That Make It The Ultimate Vacation Destination Planning your holiday in 3.context: Mandore Gardens Mandore Gardens is one of the most beautiful places to visit in Jodhpur city Jodhpur sightseeing is incomplete without visiting these gardens Brimming with cenotaphs old temples and several other Madore Garden is another wonderful destination to take you for a trip back in time The hall of heroes dedicated to Rajput folk heroes and several deities stands close to the cenotaphs Their statues are carved in stone and flamboyant The Shrine of the Three Hundred Million Gods is another attraction of this garden Climb up the hill to have a look at the ruined city of Mandore with its old palace And beware of langur monkeys in this garden They play around in hordes Entry fee NoneOpening hours Garden am to pm Sunday to Saturday Museum am to pm Saturday to Thursday Fast fact Mandore Garden is not just a garden but a complete package for ardent tourists Amidst serene garden setting it offers you an opportunity to explore breathtaking memorials an artistic temple and a host of langur monkeys at play just in case you want some fun elements added to your visit Built in 1793 Built by Maharaja Ajit Singh

4.context: Osian Temples For one of the best Jodhpur sightseeing experiences here s another on the list of places to visit in Jodhpur and around is Osian This destination awaits you at a distance of 65 km from Jodhpur in the ancient desert town of Osian Baptized as Osian Temples these 15 beautifully sculpted Hindu and Jain temples invite you Hailing from the 7th and 8th centuries these sacred places prove the architectural proficiency of ancient India Make sure that you visit Sun Temple here with other famous places in Jodhpur as it is the oldest of all Entry fee NA Opening hours From early morning to evening Fast fact Enclosed within golden sand dunes and small villages Osian offers the perfect setting to enjoy a camel safari in the desert Don t miss out on this trip Built in 783 A D Built by Pratihar Raja Vaasta Amidst Majestic Palaces Vibrant Culture Our Family Trip To Rajasthan Was A Royal Retreat

5.context: Rao Jodha Desert Rock Park Spread over 72 hectares of land the Rao Jodha Desert Rock Park in Jodhpur is a park near the Mehrangarh Fort The park was created in 2006 to restore the ecology of a rocky area and encourage the greenery around it The Park features more than 80 different plant species from the popular Thar Desert Rao Jodha Desert Rock Park is one of the most peaceful places to visit in Jodhpur Take a stroll through the park and enjoy the rawness of desert vegetation for the best Jodhpur sightseeing experience Entry fee INR 30 per adult INR 10 per student Opening hours Sunday to Saturday hours to pmFast fact The park sits on an outcrop of a volcanic rock which is in the form of vertical columns This unique characteristic of sight has won it the title of National Geological Monument Built In 2006Built by NA

6.context: Ghanta Ghar Ghanta Ghar popularly known as Clock Tower is one of the most popular places to visit in Jodhpur Located next to Sardar Market this Ghanta Ghar was built by Maharaja Sardar Singh when he reigned in the area during the early 1900s The place is frequently visited by travellers due to its proximity to the popular market Entry fee NoneOpening hours am to pmFast fact The tower was commissioned by Maharaja Sardar Singh during his reign here Built in 1880 1911 Built by Maharaja Sardar Singh Suggested Read The Best Of Adventure Royalty Our Epic Family Trip To Rajasthan

7.context: Bishnoi Village Another interesting thing to explore in Jodhpur is planning a visit to Bishnoi Village It is among the best places to see in Jodhpur The village is known for its cultural activities and you can enjoy camel trek cane spotting desert excursion village walk etc You must check out the amazing art and handicraft collection here Entry fee Free entry Opening hours am to pmFast fact You will be catching a glimpse of real Marwar culture Built in 1888 Built by Guru Jambheshwar

8.context: Kaylana Lake Kaylana Lake is one of the most beautiful artificial lakes that is located in the west of Jodhpur The lake is spread over an area of 84 square kilometres and welcomes visitors throughout the year It is one of the best Jodhpur places to visit for a fun vacay Entry fee No entry fee Opening hours am to pmFast fact The lake was constructed by Pratap Singh and was the hunting ground back then Built in 1872 Built by Pratap Singh 11 Jaisalmer Resorts To Stay For Experiencing Rajasthani Lifestyle

9.context: Tripolia Market If you wish to buy some exclusive Jodhpuri style outfits and footwear then do head to Tripolia Market Listed among the best places to visit in Jodhpur for shopping you can check out some really amazing collections of batik sarees wooden handicrafts metal accessories here Visiting this popular market is one of the best things to do in Jodhpur Entry fee None Opening hours am to pm Fast fact Don t forget to bargain here as the prices are usually quite high for visitors Built in NABuilt by NA

10.context: Balsamand Lake If you are looking for a perfect getaway from Jodhpur city then Balsamand Lake is located at a distance of 5 kilometers from the main city and is known for offering scenic beauty The place is located amidst the lush green ambiance and the stunning royal pathways enhances the beauty of this place Entry fee No entry fee Opening hours to pmFast fact The lake was constructed in the year 1159 by Balak Rao Parihar Built AD Built by rulers 21 Best Hotels In Jaipur For Enjoying A Princely Stay In The Pink City

11.context: Chand Baori Chand Baori is a famous step well of Jodhpur that was established in the 9th century This stunning step well is amongst the world s largest step well and lures travelers with its distinctive features The step well is 64 feet deep and has 13 floors making it the biggest stepwell in India This is quite popular among Jodhpur tourist places Entry fee INR 40 per person Opening hours 24 hours Fast fact The step well was built by King Chanda to meet the daily needs of the residing locals Built in 9th century Built by King Chanda

12.context: Rai Ka Bag Palace Rai ka bag palace is located in the old city of Jodhpur and is visited by almost every visitor It the the oldest attraction of this city and lures travelers with its exquisite beauty The palace was constructed by royal queen in 1663 It is among the famous places to see in Jodhpur Entry fee No entry fee Opening hours 24 hours Fast fact It was the favourite spot of Raja Jaswant Singh who reigned in the area during that time Built in 1663 Built by Hadiji 12 Best Places That Exemplify The Nightlife In Jaipur

13.context: Toorji Ka Jhalra Another popular step well in Jodhpur is Toorji ka jhalra The step well plays a significant role during the festival of Gangaur which is a women s festival Currently there are numerous shops and cafes at the spot making it one of the most popular places to see in Jodhpur Entry fee No entry fee Opening hours 24 hours Fast fact The magnificent infrastructure of this step well exhibits the true architecture Built in 1740 Built by Maharaja Abhay Singh s Consort

14.context: Trophy Bar If you are looking for a looking for a luxuriating dinner spot in the city then don t forget to head to Trophy Bar The interesting sports theme of this place makes it one of its kind As it is located in Umaid Bhawan Palace you will be catching the true glimpse of royal Rajasthani culture here The place is known to serve the best an authentic Jodhpuri cuisine This is one of the most popular Jodhpur tourist places offering a quality time Price INR for twoOpening hours am to pm 10 Reasons Why Jaipur Is One Of The Most Romantic Cities In The World

15.context: Raas Haveli Another most popular Jodhpur places to visit is Raas Haveli that offers options including the delicious Mediterranean cuisine If you are willing to eat something really healthy and fresh then don t miss out having a meal here Price INR for two Opening hours 24 hours Rajasthani Thali

16.context: Phool Mahal Phool Mahal also known as Palace of Flowers is one of the most beautiful places to see in Jodhpur The palace was built by Maharaja Abhay Singh where female dancers used to entertain him The rooms of the mahal are so charming that you will be left in awe The palace is made in the shape of a flower and is decorated with gold While going for Jodhpur sightseeing make sure you visit this Entry fee INR 20 Indians INR 250 International Opening hours am to pm Fast fact The palace is an exclusive part of Mehrangarh fort Built in 18th century Built by Maharaja Abhaya Singh 20 Best Rooftop Restaurants In Jaipur That Redefine The Nightlife Of The Pink City

17.context: Mahamandir One of the best places to see in Jodhpur is Mahamandir temple The temple is carved with 84 pillars that are the main reason for attracting so many tourists to the temple Apart from marveling at its beauty you can seek prayers at the temple and have a peaceful experience Entry fee Free Opening hours Open 24 hours Fast fact The temple has 84 pillars that are very fascinating Built in 1812Built by NA

18.context: Om Banna Temple Pali is a city in Jodhpur that is a famous place amongst the locals as well as tourists In pali there is a very popular temple which goes by the name bullet baba temple Om Banna Temple originally has a story wherein a traveler who was riding a Royal Enfield on NH65 passed away at that site In his memory and for a safe journey while traveling by NH65 people made a temple in his name The temple comprises of a bike instead of a deity and people offer their worship to the bike You won t find such a unique temple anywhere else So make sure you visit it during your trip Entry fee Free Opening hours Open 24 hours Fast fact The temple is very famous amongst the travelers who ride a Royal Enfield Top 39 Things To Do In Jaipur Exploring The Pink City All Over Again

19.context: Chamunda Mata Temple Chamunda Mata temple is very significant to the culture of the city and for the people of Jodhpur Located at the end of Mehrangarh fort the temple offers beautiful views and is known to save the city from all the troubles It is said that the kings and queens used to visit the temple for daily offerings It is one of the tourist places in Jodhpur for a peaceful vacation Entry fee Free Opening hours Open 24 hours Fast fact The temple dates back to the time of rulers of the city Built in Built by Rao Jodha

20.context: Umaid Heritage Art School If you are keen to learn some art then you should head to this art school located in Jodhpur It is an art gallery as well as a school for learning art Here you will get to witness the traditional art form of Rajasthan The good part is that popular artists are linked with the school and you can learn painting sketching in Rajasthani style The school is run by renowned artist Mr Vijay Raj Entry fee NoneOpening hours am to pm Fast Fact You can learn some nice artistic techniques here Built in NABuilt By NA Be A Part Of Marwar Festival In Jodhpur A Celebration Of Rajputana Valor

21.context: Sardar Government Museum Located in Umaid Bagh Sardar Government Museum is one of the best tourist places in Jodhpur This government museum offers an insight into the history of Jodhpur You will find things like weapons old sculptures paintings and more that speak of the royal times of the city The museum is segregated into four sections archaeological armoury history and arts You can visit them one by one and have a heartwarming experience Entry Fee No entry fee Opening hours am to pm Fast fact Witness the history of Jodhpur Built in 1909 Built by Henry Vaughan Lanchester

22.context: Splash Water Park If you want to escape the hustle and bustle of the city and want to experience something new exciting and refreshing the splash water park offers various rides that will enthrall you up from head to toe It attracts a lot of visitors from the city and is located in its vicinity So on your next holiday with your family you can consider visiting this famous Jodhpur tourist place Entry fee INR 250Opening hours am to pm Fast fact Beat the heat of Jodhpur at the fun rides Built in AD Built by Ghiyasu Tughlaq Umaid Bhawan Palace Jodhpur A Royal Home Where You Can Tie The Knot

23.context: Masuriya Hill Garden Located on the top of Masuriya hills this garden is known for offering a view of the city of Jodhpur that anybody would die for Moreover it offers lush greenery and an abundance of flora In the garden you will also find a statue of Veer Durgadas Rathore who was one of the revolutionaries in the Marwari community Undoubtedly it is one of the best tourist places in Jodhpur Entry fee No entry fee Opening hours am to pm Fast fact The garden is dedicated to a hero of Marwari community

24.context: Shastri Circle You might be thinking what to do on the last day of your trip when you have covered everything and there is less time before you catch your Well Shastri Circle is another famous Jodhpur tourist places that comes into the scene in such cases It is a hangout place for the locals where you will find a playground for children various eateries and a fountain that offers light and sound shows Entry fee No entry fee Opening hours Open 24 hours Fast fact Light and sound shows With These Top 4 Adventure Sports In Jodhpur Challenge Your Inner Daredevil

25.context: Ranisar Padamsar Lake Sisters The two famous lakes are located at the other end of the fort This is what you will get to know about these two beautiful places in Jodhpur These lakes were of very good use in the old times as they were the of water in those times for the people Representing the ancient water systems the lakes provide a scenic view and tranquillity and is among the best places to see in Jodhpur Entry fee No entry fee Opening hours Open 24 hours Fast fact Watch the old water system Built in NABuilt by Queen Jasmade Hadi

26.context: Fun World Immortal Shots for Pexels A complete family entertainment place Fun World is one of the best places to visit in Jodhpur It is one of a kind resort in Jodhpur equipped with facilities and amenities for a fun day out The luxury resort houses 50 rooms and provides a peaceful and fresh environment for you to relax The waterpark has a big swimming pool while the amusement park has amazing water slides Head here for one of a kind experience with your closed ones Entry fee INR 500Opening hours am to pmFast fact Experience thrill on different kinds of slide Nightlife In Jodhpur 6 Ways Of Savoring Its Real Essence

27.context: Sardar Market Acred for Wikimedia Sardar market is among the popular tourist places in Jodhpur for all the shopaholics It is named after Maharaja Sardar Singh Selling wide variety of items like silver jewellery spices pottery vegetables local fabrics it is one of the busiest markets in Jodhpur Not only can you shop here but you can also try local food items Entry fee None Opening hours am to pm Fast fact A marketplace where you can find everything under one roof Built in NABuilt by Maharaja Sardar Singh To Do And Attractions For Couple

28.context: Khejarla Fort Official Website of Fort Khejrala Have you ever wondered about the life of royal kings living in splendid castles If yes then visiting this famous Khejrala Fort will be one of a kind experience for you It is among the best Jodhpur tourist places and is a for those who want to experience the rich culture of ancient India The fort is a perfect example of a good blend of royal and rural It is an ancient monument that has been converted now into an ancient hotel Entry fee None Opening hours Open 24 hours Fast fact Witness the rich ancient culture Built in 1611 AD Built by Maharaja of Jodhpur Honeymoon In Rajasthan 6 Things To Do And Attractions For Couple

29.context: Machia Biological Park Rijin for Wikimedia Disclaimer The is for representation purposes only Located about 8 km from the city Machia Biological Park is one of the best places to visit in Jodhpur for nature lovers It is home to multiple wild animals like wolves lions jackals tigers deer sloth leopards gharial and porcupines There is also a spot for bird watching For the best experience visit the park early in the morning Entry fee INR 30 for adults and INR 15 for students Opening hours am to pm summers and 8 30 am to pm winters Fast fact A decent zoo and conservation project Built in 1935 Built by Maharaja Umaid Singh

30.context: Flying Fox Sbohra Go on a thrilling glide across two desert lakes and relish the exotic views of Mehrangarh with Flying Fox in Jodhpur This adventurous activity consists of 6 zip lines up to 300 meters These zip lines soar high above the state countryside and offer breathtaking views of Chokeloa Palace and Garden Mehrangarh Fort Balsamand Lake Palace Ranisar Lake and the Rao Jodha Park Charges INR 1700 onwards Opening hours am to pm Location Jai Pol Jodhpur Best Resorts In Jaipur For A Comfortable Yet Regal Staycation

31.context: Nirali Dhani Chayandunks7 Offering a fantastic Rajasthani menu the place brims with authenticity condenses the cultural Bonanza of the state One of the most famous Jodhpur places to visit that features a traditional setting Here the thali is served like nowhere else and you ll get unlimited food for as many times you want Not only the food but even the place is also a perfect depiction of Rajasthani architecture and obviously the dining options are parted into Jiman Padharo Sa and Jo Hukum Bar Starting price INR 100 Opening hours pm to pm throughout the week Location Siddhanath Circle Near Chopasni Filter House Chopasni Road Jodhpur Rajasthan 342001 Thali

32.context: Takht Sagar Lake Amanjeev for Wikimedia One of the surreal and tranquil situated near the city of Jodhpur is Takhat Sagar Lake The lake is situated on the outskirts of the city and is a gorgeous place to go for a drive to It is dotted by lush greenery and is a quiet area This not very famous destination offers a refreshing break for all the travelers Here one can witness stunning views of the sunset so don t delay any further to plan your trip see what all Jodhpur tourism has to offer Entry fee None Opening hours Open 24 hours Location Takhat Sagar Hills Jodhpur Jantar Mantar Jaipur The World s Largest Sundial

33.context: Sardar Samand Lake Dr Rushikesh Joshi for Wikimedia This is one of the best Jodhpur places to visit that will give you a whole other definition of tranquility The lake is located close to the city of Jodhpur and offers lush green views to travelers Here you ll see many exotic species of migratory birds which enhances the beauty of the lake Thus the place is good for bird watching Entry fee None Opening hours Open 24 hours Location Sardar Samand Lake Tehsil Sojat City District Pali Suggested Read Get The Rajasthani Bohemia On 17 Amazing Shopping Places In Jaipur To Explore

34.context: On The Rocks A one of a kind restaurant that is located in the magnificent Blue City of Jodhpur The place is ideal for dining in with your family and friends It is one of the opulent places to visit in Jodhpur and it strikes the perfect balance between quaint and contemporary Get to this place to enjoy a fusion of tradition royalty and grandeur Opening hours pm to pm and pm to pm Location Ajit Bhawan National Highway 65 Near Circuit House Rd Ajit Colony Jodhpur Rajasthan drinks beers 25 Best Restaurants In Jaipur To Relish Royal Meals On Your Vacay

35.context: Umed Garden Zoo Taj Hotels Resorts and Palaces for wikimedia Explore the wilderness of this place as this is home to some of the exotic wildlife species One can explore and witness migratory birds soothe themselves amidst the greenery and spot animals at this abode The place is suitable for both adults and children Entry fee INR 3 per person Indians INR 10 Foreign tourists Opening hours am to pm Location Jodhpur Rajasthan 342001

36.context: Arna Jharna Avinashpatni000 for wikimedia A desert museum that has an actual waterfall inside its premises which makes it all the more stunning The museum preserves Rajasthani artworks in the form of paintings and sculptures and is spread over an area of around 10 acres It also conducts workshops live music and dance sessions that the travellers can attend Entry fee INR 200 for Indians and INR 400 for tourists Opening hours am to pm Location Arna Vihar Near Famous Arneshwar Mahadev Mandir Arna Jharna Village Moklawas Rajasthan 342001 9 Best Places To Visit Near Sikar To Get Closer To The Rajasthani Roots

37.context: Guda Lake Notorious4life for wikimedia From blackbucks to deers various animals can be seen drinking water on the shores of this lake Enjoy the stunning beauty of this lake with your travel buddies and see what Jodhpur tourism has to offer for you Entry fee None Opening hours Open 24 hours from Monday to Saturday Location Bishnoi Village Village Guda Bishnoi Jodhpur Rajasthan 342802

38.context: Mishrilal Lassi Vala Mishrilal Lassi Wala has been operating for more than 50 years For the past few years it has settled a legacy of serving flavorous drinks From thick delicious lassis to freshly prepared namkeens you ll find l kinds of local snacks served here The extra layer of malai on the top is like a cherry on the cake that s what makes the Lassi just delicious Not just the natives but the tourists from various places come here to savour a sweet glass of pure heaven Opening hours am to pm Location Clock Tower Paan Gali Jodhpur Rajasthan 342001 Lassis Ziplining In Jodhpur A Comprehensive Guide To Flying Over The Blue City

39.context: Khichan Bird Sanctuary Chinmayisk for wikimedia A village in Rajasthan where this sanctuary is situated it s a popular tourist attraction one of the Jodhpur places to visit Khichan Bird Sanctuary is located right next to a lake in Khichan where you can spot multiple species of bird species that migrate from other regions The place offers stunning views don t miss this on your to Jaisalmer from Jodhpur Entry fee None Opening hours am to pm Distance from Jodhpur 142 km

40.context: Dhawa Doli Wildlife Sanctuary One of the best places to visit in Jodhpur Dhawa Doli Wildlife Sanctuary is famous for sites fascinating wildlife While visiting here you can witness Indian Antelopes in large numbers Furthermore animals like Wild Buffalo Blue Bull Wild Boar Gaur or Bison Black Buck Antelope Chinkara and Chital can also be spotted in the wildlife sanctuary Fauna here is quite intriguing as the sanctuary boasts many types of trees including Khejri tree Kumat tree Banyan tree Pipar tree and more Entry fee NoneOpening hours am to pmFast fact The sanctuary boasts a wide range of rare and endangered animals Built in NA Built by NA Temples In Jodhpur for A Divine Holiday In The Blue City

41.context: Phalodi Jodhpur Nestled in the Phalodi Tehsil in Jodhpur Phalodi is popularly known as the salt city owing to its numerous salt industries The town further features several notable historic structures namely Phalodi Fort Lal Niwas and more While visiting Jodhpur you must spend a day or two in this town Entry fee NoneOpening hours NA Fast fact The town is house to numerous salt industries Built in NABuilt by NA In a nutshell the city leaves you awestruck with its architectural wonders that have stood the test of time Fascinated by its magnetism What are you thinking about Frequently Asked Questions About Places To Visit In Jodhpur Is it safe to visit Jodhpur during COVID times You need to follow all the mandatory guidelines mentioned by the government such as maintaining social distance wearing masks washing or sanitizing hands regularly etc for a safe travel experience Check the travel guidelines mentioned by the state and follow them meticulously Is Jodhpur worth visiting The blue city of Rajasthan Jodhpur is adorned with stunning forts impeccable gardens and eminent temples If you are a traveler who has an interest in getting acquainted with the history and culture of all the marvelous cities spread throughout the world then Jodhpur is undoubtedly worth visiting Innumerable tourist places and the beauty of the city will make your vacation a memorable one What is Jodhpur famous for Jodhpur is famous for its rich history grand forts astounding temples and enticing shopping markets The city is also famous as the Blue city as its buildings were painted blue to denote that the buildings belonged to the Brahmins How many days should I spend in Jodhpur Jodhpur has a lot of forts and historical attractions that you should definitely visit on your vacation You must plan a 3 or 4 days trip as there are a lot of ravishing places to visit in Jodhpur that you should miss out on during your vacation What should I buy from Jodhpur Jodhpur has terrific markets from which you can buy amazing things like Tie and Dye Sarees Leather shoes Handicraft items and traditional spices Which is the best area to stay in Jodhpur The most popular area to stay in Jodhpur is the Clock Tower as all the luxurious hotels are located in this area The Clock Tower has a remarkable location as all the major tourist attractions are also located near it If you want to stay at a place which is located in the heart of the city and is in close proximity to the famous forts and restaurants then Clock Tower is an ideal choice for you What is the best time to visit Jodhpur The best time to visit Jodhpur is in the winter season as the weather is pleasant and you can easily explore all the forts and temples without sweating and getting tanned Why is Jodhpur called the Blue City Jodhpur is called the Blue City as a lot of buildings in the city are blue in color It is believed that the Brahmins colored the building in blue color as the buildings belonged
